pull.title: docs: add release note for 14954
pull.body: Adds a release note for #14954: build: Require python 3.5.

verification.payload:
tree 9fd38252d44c42128e1dc6318ca677668e9302c5
parent 76e2cded477bc483ec610212bdadf21fe35292d4
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1558064064 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1559067451 -0400

docs: add release note for 14954

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,3 @@
+Build system changes
+--------------------
+Python >=3.5 is now required by all aspects of the project. This includes the build systems, test framework, linters and Travis CI. The previously supported minimum (3.4), was EOL in March 2019. See #14954 for more details.
comments.body: Not sure if we should mention "travis" as part of the project. Also I didn't explicitly break the build system to not work with 3.4, only the tests. I'd be surprised if anyone ran them, and if someone did with 3.4, they fail anyway, e.g. when `.hex()` is not available.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,3 @@
+Build system changes
+--------------------
+Python >=3.5 is now required by all aspects of the project. This includes the build systems, test framework, linters and Travis CI. The previously supported minimum (3.4), was EOL in March 2019. See #14954 for more details.
comments.body: I think having different python version requirements for different parts of the project is confusing, and very hard to enforce, so even if some scripts are compatible with 3.4 (or below) I think it makes sense to be sweeping in this message.
